title: Gwyneth Paltrow offers advice on ANAL sex in her lifestyle blog Goop's sex issue
text:
Gwyneth Paltrow offers advice on ANAL sex in her lifestyle blog Goop's sex issue Actress advises readers on how to have "good casual sex" Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
Gwyneth Paltrow usually uses her lifestyle blog Goop to inform readers about the benefits of eating a gluten-free diet or rubbing almond oil into your baby bump. 
But readers of her latest post must have done a double take as she offered candid advice on something rather different – anal sex. 
In a question and answer session with author Paul Joannides, the 44-year-old's website declared that anal is now "practically standard in the modern bedroom repertoire". 
The article continues: "If anal turns you on, you are definitely not alone." Gwyneth Paltrow's website offers advice on anal sex (Photo: Getty) 
Goop then offers advice on how to "modify anal sex" to suit a real-life couple. 
"One of the first things a woman or man needs to do if they want to be on the receiving end of anal sex is to teach their sphincter muscles to relax enough that a penis can get past their gates. This takes a lot of practice," the site says. 
"Also, unlike the vagina, the anus provides no lubrication. So in addition to teaching the sphincters to relax, and in addition to getting the angle right so you don’t poke the receiver in the wall of the rectum, you need to use lots of lube." It advises using plenty of lube (Photo: Reuters) 
So far, so useful. 
"Do not use numbing lube, and do not have anal sex while drunk or stoned," the website continued. 
"Pain is an important indicator that damage can occur if you don’t make the necessary adjustments, including stopping. If there is pain, perhaps try replacing a penis with a well lubed and gloved finger. 
"The glove will help your finger glide more easily, and might be more pleasurable for the person on the receiving end. Also, this allows a woman to do anal play on a male partner." 
The guide to anal sex is part of Goop's latest newsletter The Sex Issue that also covers casual sex and orgasm equality. Like us on Facebook
